items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Churn, Hilcot Brook, Daglingworth Stream, Gumstool Brook

items.message:
Flooding remains possible.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue, river levels along the River Churn remain high, particularly in Cerney Wick. The weather forecast is for dry conditions to continue through Boxing Day, overnight and into tomorrow, 27 December 2025. River levels are falling very slowly. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 12:00, midday, on the 27 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Windrush from Bourton to Newbridge
items.message:
The flood risk remains.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue as river levels along the River Windrush remain high, particularly in Bourton on the Water, Witney, Standlake and Newbridge areas. The weather forecast is for dry conditions to continue through Boxing Day, overnight and into tomorrow, 27 December 2025. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 12:00, midday, on the 27 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Evenlode from Moreton in Marsh to Cassington and also the River Glyme at Wootton and Woodstock
items.message:
High river levels have led to flooding of land close to the River Glyme. 

Flooding of low lying land and roads remains possible today on the River Glyme at Woodstock. The river is now flowing within banks on the River Evenlode although water will remain in fields close to the river over the next few days. The weather forecast is for dry conditions to continue through Boxing Day, overnight and into tomorrow, 27 December 2025. We expect river levels on the River Glyme to remain high over the next few days.  

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 12:00, midday, on the 27 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Thames and its small tributaries from Calcutt to Lechlade

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Thames, Blunsdon Brook, Water Eaton Brook, Marston Meysey Brook, Share Ditch, Bydemill Brook, Westrop Brook, Downington Brook

items.message:
High river levels have led to flooding of land close to the river.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today because river levels along the River Thames remain high, particularly in the Kempsford area. 

The weather forecast is for dry conditions to continue through Boxing Day, overnight and into tomorrow, 27 December 2025. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 12:00, midday, on the 27 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Dikler from Condicote to Little Rissington
items.message:
High river levels may lead to flooding. 

Flooding of low lying land and roads remains possible today in the Bourton on the Water area.  The weather forecast is for dry conditions to continue through Boxing Day, overnight and into tomorrow, 27 December 2025. River levels are currently stable. We expect river levels to remain high over the coming days.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 12:00, midday, on the 27 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Leach from Northleach to Mill Lane near Lechlade
items.message:
The flood risk remains.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue as river levels remain high, especially in the Lechlade area.  The weather forecast is for dry conditions to continue through Boxing Day, overnight and into tomorrow, 27 December 2025. River levels are falling slowly. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 12:00, midday, on the 27 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Thames and tributaries from Buscot Wick down to Kings Lock
items.message:
High river levels have led to flooding of land close to the river.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue, as levels on the River Thames remains high, particularly between Radcot and Oxford. The weather forecast is for dry conditions to continue through Boxing Day, overnight and into tomorrow, 27 December 2025. River levels are falling slowly, but are expected to remain high over the coming days. River levels between Lechlade and Radcot are now below the flood risk threshold, but standing water is likely to remain on paths and fields alongside the river.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 12:00, midday, on the 27 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Flooding remains possible.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected, especially around Fossebridge and Bibury. The weather forecast is for dry conditions to continue through Boxing Day, overnight and into tomorrow, 27 December 2025. River levels are currently stable and we expect river levels to remain high over the coming days. 

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 12:00, midday, on the 27 December 2025 or as the situation changes.
